an4.158:5.1: “Reverends, any monk or nun who sees four things inside themselves should conclude:
an4.158:5.3: For this is what the Buddha calls decline.’
an4.158:5.5: They have much greed, much hate, and much delusion; and their wisdom eye doesn’t go into the many deep matters.
an4.158:5.6: Any monk or nun who sees these four things inside themselves should conclude:
an4.158:5.8: For this is what the Buddha calls decline.’
an4.158:6.1: Any monk or nun who sees four things inside themselves should conclude:
an4.158:6.3: For this is what the Buddha calls non-decline.’
an4.158:6.5: Their greed, hate, and delusion grow less; and their wisdom eye goes into the many deep matters.
an4.158:6.6: Any monk or nun who sees these four things inside themselves should conclude:
an4.158:6.8: For this is what the Buddha calls non-decline.’”
